commit message: Modified 'DownloadManagerService' in order to be able to resume the updating of a shared deck, so if the update it is stopped somehow the work done is not lost.
Merge branch 'maintenance_0.4' of http://github.com/nicolas-raoul/Anki-Android into maintenance_0.4

Merged master branch into new_design branch, that is to say, merged AnkiDroid 0.4.2 into AnkiDroid 0.5. There are still some details to be polished but the main functionalities seem to be working fine.
Added permission needed by VeeCheck
Copied icons from drawable-mdpi to drawable. Solves crash on HTC Magic/Android 1.5, which could not find the icons and was force closing
Relabeled Red-Black-Blue to Failed-Due-New. This is displayed for a few seconds while the deck is loading, so I think it is a good opportunity to explain to the user what those numbers mean.
Commented setScrollbarFadingEnabled because of issue 168. If it breaks anything, please report it there.

Complete fix for issue #168: Now, showing always the scrollbars when there is more content that the one that fits on the screen works on older versions also, without crashing. Also, included standard Android images that are not available for older versions.
Merge with Nicolas' master.

Integrated Error Reporter to AnkiDroid 0.5.

Completely refactored Sound class: Implemented a new solution for handling sounds, made the code clearer and released the MediaPlayer correctly. Now, if a card has a lot of sounds they should play correctly.
Fixed a mistake on the ending condition of the new code for audio, so the last sound in a card was never played.

work in progress - optimizations

Complete fix for issue #170, suggested by Marcus: Added the base path for media and other files to the call loadDataWithBaseURL, using the file protocol. With this solution, we don't need the Content Provider that was used to load images anymore, so I deleted it.

Fix for issue #195: Now AnkiDroid lets the user login even if his password contains non alphanumeric characters. Taking into account that in the registration to AnkiOnline non alphanumeric characters are not allowed and later on they can be inputted changing the password from AnkiOnline, maybe this issue has to be checked again when in AnkiOnline a consistent solution is implemented. That is to say, when the next issue is solved: http://code.google.com/p/anki/issues/detail?id=1932

Fix for issue #117: Local images are scaled to fit the screen by default, but the possibility to zoom has also been added in case we want to appreciate the details more clearly. For images linked from web this functionality has still to be implemented.

Fix for issue #206: Javascript has been activated and the card template has been removed from strings.xml and put like an asset, in order to avoid confusions and to make editing easier. work in progress - optimization

Fix for issue #202 and implemented a complete new solution for handling images. Now, all images are resized using Javascript to fit the available space on screen. It works both for local and remote images, for both portrait and landscape and even, if the device is rotated reviewing a card, the card is refreshed so its images will be rescaled to make better use of the available space. I also deleted the Image class because it was not necessary anymore.

Change 'show notification bar' option for 'review in fullscreen'. Now
the title bar is hidden too, and displaying the options menu brings back
the notification bar. This is useful for example if the user wants to
know what time it is, or to check a mail that arrived during review.
Unfortunately, Android does not allow to display the title bar once it
has been hidden.
